Cependant, il arrive souvent que ces sous-classes accordent des options de mouvement qui sont déjà accordées par la race, comme une vitesse de nage ou de vol, ce qui crée de la frustration pour certains joueurs concernés par des capacités qui ne sont pas utiles. Pour aider à atténuer ces frustrations sans modifier de manière significative l'équilibre du jeu, votre DM peut choisir d'utiliser la règle optionnelle suivante.

Lorsqu'un effet accorderait à une créature une vitesse d'escalade, de vol ou de natation, si cette créature possède déjà ce type de vitesse accordée par un trait racial, elle peut choisir de voir sa vitesse naturelle augmentée d'un montant égal aux deux tiers de la vitesse accordée pour la même durée. Vous ne pouvez avoir qu'un seul de ces effets actif à la fois.

Par exemple, si une créature ayant une vitesse de nage raciale de 40 pieds se voit accorder une vitesse de nage de 60 pieds par un sort, une caractéristique de classe, un objet magique, etc., cette créature peut choisir d'augmenter sa vitesse de nage raciale de 40 pieds pour la durée de l'effet, ce qui lui donne une vitesse totale de 80 pieds.

optionalfeature.name: Deathly Chills
entries: When you deal cold damage to a creature using a warlock spell or feature, you ignore resistance to cold damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to necrotic damage, and you treat vulnerability to necrotic damage as vulnerability to both damage types.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Digestion
entries: When you deal acid damage to a creature using a warlock spell or feature, you ignore resistance to acid damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to force damage, and you treat vulnerability to force damage as vulnerability to both damage types.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: When you finish a long rest, you choose one of four elements below to attune to. While attuned to an element, you know an associated cantrip (each is from {@i Xanathar's Guide to Everything}) as a warlock spell, and it doesn't count against the number of cantrips you can know as a warlock. You gain the following benefits while attuned to each element:

entries.name: Air
entries: You know the {@spell gust|XGE} cantrip, and you can hold your breath for twice as long.

entries.name: Earth
entries: You know the {@spell mold earth|XGE} cantrip, and you have advantage on ability checks to climb earth or stone.

entries.name: Fire
entries: You know the {@spell control flames} cantrip, and you have advantage on saving throws made to resist the effects of extreme heat.

entries.name: Water
entries: You know the {@spell shape water} cantrip, and you have advantage on saving throws made to resist the effects of extreme cold.

optionalfeature.name: Heavenly Bolts
entries: When you deal lightning damage to a creature using a warlock spell or feature, you ignore resistance to lightning damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to radiant damage, and you treat vulnerability to radiant damage as vulnerability to both damage types.

optionalfeature.name: Hush of Winter
entries: When you deal cold damage to a creature using a warlock spell or feature, you can force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition deafened} and can't speak until the end of your next turn.
Once you use this invocation, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Noxious Fumes
entries: When you deal acid damage to a creature using a warlock spell or feature, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.
Once you use this invocation, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Prismatic Blaze
entries: When you deal fire damage to a creature that isn't {@condition blinded} using a warlock spell or feature, you can force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0. The effect ends if the target takes any additional damage or if someone else uses an action to shake it out of its stupor.
Once you use this invocation, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Scorching Radiance
entries: When you deal radiant damage to a creature using a warlock spell or feature, you ignore resistance to radiant damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to fire damage, and you treat vulnerability to fire damage as vulnerability to both damage types.

optionalfeature.name: Umbra Flame
entries: When you deal fire damage to a creature using a warlock spell or feature, you ignore resistance to fire damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to necrotic damage, and you treat vulnerability to necrotic damage as vulnerability to both damage types.

optionalfeature.name: Voice from Beyond
entries: When you deal thunder damage to a creature using a warlock spell or feature, you ignore resistance to thunder damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to psychic damage, and you treat vulnerability to psychic damage as vulnerability to both damage types.

optionalfeature.name: Welcoming Light
entries: When you deal radiant damage to a creature using a warlock spell or feature, you can force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition charmed} by you until the end of your next turn. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target regards you as a friendly acquaintance.
Once you use this invocation, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Whisper the Dread Wind
entries: When you deal thunder damage to a creature using a warlock spell or feature, you can force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition frightened} of you until the end of its next turn.
Once you use this invocation, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Withering Lightning
entries: When you deal lightning damage to a creature using a warlock spell or feature, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target's hit point maximum is reduced for 1 minute by an amount equal to the lightning damage it took. Any effect that removes a disease allows the target's hit point maximum to return to normal before that time passes.
Once you use this invocation, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Ambassador of the Depths
entries: You can expend a warlock spell slot to cast the new {@spell dive|TEB} spell. While the spell affects a target, that target also has {@sense darkvision} that extends out to a range of 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Desert Roamer
entries: You are adapted to both hot climates and cold climates, as described in the Dungeon Master's Guide, and you don't need to drink water to survive.

optionalfeature.name: Flame Walker
entries: You and any equipment you are wearing or carrying are immune to the damage dealt by nonmagical fire, and you can breathe ashes, smoke, and the stinking cloud spell without any negative effects. This can't prevent damage dealt by traps or creatures, such as the breath weapon of a red dragon or the blast of a fire cannon.

optionalfeature.name: Weightlessness
entries: You can cast {@spell feather fall} targeting only yourself at wili without expending a spell slot or requiring components.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Vengeance

otherSummary.entry: {@spell fireball} known as a warlock spell
otherSummary.entrySummary: Fireball known as a warlock spell

entries: When another creature deals damage to your familiar and reduces it to 0 hit points, you can choose to use your reaction to cast {@spell fireball} using a warlock spell slot centered at the location of your familiar, even if it is outside your normal range or line of sight for the spell. The spell originates from your familiar. After you do this, you gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} and you can't cast any spells of 1st-level or higher on your next turn.
Once you use this invocation, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Graveborne
entries: While you are {@condition buried|TEB} or burrowing in earth or sealed underground, you don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

optionalfeature.name: Breath of Bahamut
entries: You can use an action to expend a warlock spell slot to exhale a secondary breath weapon in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area suffers the following effects, determined by your dragon patron's kind. These effects end instantly if you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell). Any saving throws are made against your warlock spell save DC.

entries.name: Brass
entries: Targets must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it. Any creature with hit points equal to or greater than your warlock level x 4 automatically succeeds on the saving throw.

entries.name: Bronze
entries: Targets must succeed on a Strength saving throw or else be pushed 60 feet away from you.

entries.name: Copper
entries: Each target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. Also, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, but not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Gold
entries: Each target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or suffer disadvantage on Strength-based attacks, Strength checks, and other Strength saving throws for 1 minute. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Silver
entries: Targets must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of your next turn. Any creature with hit points equal to or greater than your warlock level x 3 automatically succeeds on the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Tiamat's Bargain
entries: When you use your Breath of the Wyrm feature, you can choose to use the breath weapon and damage type of any of the chromatic dragons from the list, instead of using the entry for your patron.
When you finish a long rest, you can choose to change the damage type that your Draconic Essence feature grants resistance to. Choose one from acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Fiery Breath

otherSummary.entry: {@spell burning hands} known as a warlock spell
otherSummary.entrySummary: Burning hands known as a warlock spell

entries: When you cast {@spell burning hands}, you can do so as a bonus action, requiring only verbal components. Once you do, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Open the Gate Below

otherSummary.entry: Any Water-themed Patron or {@feat Hydromancer|TEB} feat
otherSummary.entrySummary: Any Water-themed Patron or Hydromancer feat

entries: You can expend a warlock spell slot to cast the new {@spell dark lagoon|TEB} spell, requiring only somatic components. Once you do so, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Tentacle Growth
entries: You have an additional extremely flexible arm (a tentacle) that has reach 10 feet. Melee weapons wielded using this arm and no other arms have an additional 5 feet of reach, but the arm cannot wear shields. You also have advantage on ability checks made to grapple using this arm. If the arm is cut off or destroyed, it regrows with no apparent damage when you finish a long rest.
You can take this invocation multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Treants
entries: You can expend the 8th-level use of your Mystic Arcanum to cast the new {@spell animate tree|TEB} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Hellish Blood
entries: You are constantly affected by a lesser form of {@spell fire shield} (warm option) that deals only {@dice 1d6} damage. You can also expend a warlock spell slot to cast {@spell fire shield} (as warm option only) on yourself as a bonus action, to increase the effect to that of a {@spell fire shield} that deals {@dice 2d8} + {@dice 1d6} fire damage for the normal duration.

optionalfeature.name: Lost to the Cosmos
entries: You can cast {@spell nondetection} using a warlock spell slot without requiring components, but you can only target yourself when you do so.

optionalfeature.name: Pull of the Dark
entries: When you hit a creature with {@spell eldritch blast} more than once in a turn, you can have it make a Strength saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature is knocked prone or pulled up to 10 feet toward you (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Wave Caller

otherSummary.entry: Any Water-themed Patron or {@feat Hydromancer|TEB} feat
otherSummary.entrySummary: Any Water-themed Patron or Hydromancer feat

entries: You can cast {@spell control water} at-will, expending no spell slots and requiring only verbal components.

optionalfeature.name: Consign to the Earth
entries: You can expend the 9th-level use of your Mystic Arcanum to cast the new {@spell earth whelm|TEB} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Fog Form
entries: You can expend the 9th-level use of your Mystic Arcanum to cast the new {@spell ordainment of mist} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Magma Form
entries: You can expend the 9th-level use of your Mystic Arcanum to cast the new {@spell ordainment of lava} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Steel Form
entries: You can expend the 9th-level use of your Mystic Arcanum to cast the new {@spell ordainment of steel} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Peers of the Patron
entries: You can expend the 9th-level use of your Mystic Arcanum to cast the new {@spell summon primal spirit|TEB} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Tame the Wind
entries: You can expend the 9th-level use of your Mystic Arcanum to cast the new {@spell wind wake|TEB} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Thousand-Year Flood
entries: You can expend the 9th-level use of your Mystic Arcanum to cast the new {@spell grand flood|TEB} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Volcanic Herald
entries: You can expend the 9th-level use of your Mystic Arcanum to cast the new {@spell caldera|TEB} spell.

feat.name: Aeromancer
entries: You specialize in the magic of the air, commanding howling wind and thunderous storm. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule spell prowess|TEB} with {@book aeromancy spells|TEB|2|Aeromancy Spells}.
The spells {@spell control winds|XGE},* {@spell gust|XGE},* {@spell silence}, and {@spell whirlwind|XGE}* are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class.

When you cast an aeromancy spell, you choose one creature within 5 feet of you. That creature cannot make opportunity attacks against you this turn. Also, if the spell pushes or pulls any creature, it moves that creature 5 extra feet.

When you cast an aeromancy spell of 1st level or higher, if you have a flying speed, you may choose to increase it by 15 feet for that turn. If you don't, you gain a flying speed of 15 feet for that turn, and if you are still aloft at the end of the turn, you fall unless you are held aloft by other means.

feat.name: Elementalist
entries: You specialize in all four elements—air, earth, fire, and water—commanding them as one in a flowing, weaving rhythm. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule spell prowess|TEB} with {@book Elemancy spells|TEB|2|Elemancy Spells}.

The spells {@spell absorb elements|XGE}* and {@spell elemental bane|XGE}* are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class, plus the new spells {@spell golem armor|TEB} and {@spell magic orb|TEB}.
After you cast an aeromancy, geomancy, hydromancy, or pyromancy spell you gain {@variantrule spell prowess|TEB} with spells of the other three specializations until the end of your next turn.

When you cast an aeromancy, geomancy, hydromancy, or pyromancy spell of 1st-level or higher, if you have {@variantrule spell prowess|TEB} with the spell, you can choose a damage type out of acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. You gain resistance to that damage type until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Energy Specialist
entries: You have explored the mysteries of one of the energies of your magic, gaining you the following benefits:

items: This feat can be taken multiple times, but you must choose a different damage type each time.
Choose one damage type from the table below. You apply half your proficiency bonus to your spells' damage rolls of the chosen type.

Whenever a creature rolls a 1 on the d20 for a saving throw from a spell you cast that deals damage of the chosen type and it fails the save, the spell inflicts a special effect on it. If you critically hit a creature with a spell attack from a spell you cast that deals damage of the chosen type, the spell also inflicts the special effect on the target. The special effect depends on the damage type, as shown in the table below:

rows: The target grants enemies advantage on attacks made against it until the end of its next turn, and if it wears nonmagical armor, that armor is corroded and loses 3 AC permanently.
The target is {@condition restrained} until the start of its next turn, and has its speed reduced by half until the end of its next turn.
The target is lit ablaze. It takes fire damage equal to your proficiency bonus at the start of each of its turns until a creature takes an action to douse the fire.
The target is knocked {@condition prone} and is unable to take reactions until the end of its next turn.
The target can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn, and if the target isn't an undead or a construct, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.
The target is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. If it was already {@condition poisoned}, it becomes {@condition paralyzed} until the start of its next turn instead.
The target is {@condition frightened} of you or {@condition charmed} by you (your choice) until the end of its next turn.
The target has disadvantage on attack rolls that rely on sight until the end of its next turn.
The target is {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn, and you can choose to push the target up to 15 feet away from you.

feat.name: Geomancer
entries: You specialize in the magic of the earth, commanding earthen arms and armor and beckoning quakes from the ground beneath you. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule spell prowess|TEB} with {@book geomancy spells|TEB|2|Geomancy Spells}
The spells {@spell bones of the earth|XGE},* {@spell mold earth|XGE},* {@spell shield of faith}, and {@spell stone shape} are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class.

Whenever you cast a geomancy spelL you gain a +1 bonus to AC and temporary hit points equal to half of your proficiency bonus, both of which last until the end of your next turn or until you roll initiative.
Whenever you make a saving throw to maintain concentration on a geomancy spell, you roll {@dice 1d4} and add it to the result.

feat.name: Hydromancer
entries: You specialize in the magic of water, commanding seas, rivers, glaciers, and steam geysers all as one. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule spell prowess|TEB} with {@book hydromancy spells|TEB|2|Hydromancy Spells}
The spells {@spell create or destroy water}, {@spell maelstrom|XGE},* {@spell shape water|XGE},* and {@spell tsunami} are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class.
The range for your hydromancy spells is increased by 30 feet, unless the spell's range is Self. This also increases the range of Touch spells.

When a hydromancy spell that you cast pushes or pulls a creature, it moves that creature 10 extra feet. When one knocks a creature {@condition prone}, you can choose to also push that creature 10 feet away from you. When one reduces a creature's speed, it is reduced by 10 additional feet. When one creates liquid water, it creates twice as much.

feat.name: Pyromancer
entries: You specialize in the magic of flame, commanding the largest, brightest, and most explosive of fires to reduce nearly anything to ash, smoke, and cinders. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule spell prowess|TEB} with {@book pyromancy spells|TEB|2|Pyromancy Spells}
The spells {@spell control flames|XGE},* {@spell fire storm}, {@spell heat metal}, and {@spell immolation|XGE}* are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class.
When you cast a pyromancy spelL you can choose to shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet until the end of your next turn.
When you cast a pyromancy spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose to explode the spell or ignite the spell.

entries.name: Pyromancy: Exploding and Igniting
entries: Whenever you cast a pyromancy spell that is {@b exploded}, you may choose the spell's range or one length, range, or radius within the spell's description. You treat that range, length, or radius as if it were 5 feet longer for this casting of the spell. This bonus cannot increase the range of any Self or Touch effects or spell ranges.

Right after you cast a pyromancy spell that is {@b ignited}, you can choose to ignite flammable objects that are not being worn or carried in a particular area. That area is your choice of the spell's area, the area within 10 feet of you, or the area within 10 feet of one creature or object that was dealt fire damage by the spell (you choose each time you cast). Each affected object that is already on fire takes fire damage equal to your proficiency bonus+ twice the spell's level that ignores resistance instead.

feat.name: Summoner
entries: You specialize in the magic of summoning powerful creatures to aid you in combat. Any creature summoned or created by a spell that you cast appears with 1 extra hit point per Hit Die it has. While you are within 30 feet of it and you can see it and control it, it gains a bonus to its AC and saving throws equal to half your proficiency bonus, and any ability checks to dispel it are made with disadvantage. This feat does not affect creatures you summon that have class levels.

entries.name: Hit Dice for Summoned Creature
entries: Some summoning spells, such as {@spell summon beast|TCE} or {@spell summon shadowspawn|TCE}, use statistics for creatures that do not have any hit dice. When an effect such as that of the Summoner feat grants a creature extra hit points based on the number of Hit Dice it has, you can treat those creatures as if they had 1 Hit Die for every 8 maximum hit points, before any increases to hit points are applied.

feat.name: Ward Mage
entries: You have learned how to bolster your shields, barriers, and walls of magic beyond their normal capabilities in order to better control a battlefield and protect yourself and your allies. You gain the following benefits:

items: When one of your spells or class features grants a protective ward with hit points to a creature (such as the Abjuration Wizard's ward, or the new {@spell barrier|TEB} spell} you grant that ward extra hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

When a spell you cast creates a wall or barrier with no creature as a target (such as {@spell wall of stone} or the new {@spell screen of protection|TEB} spell} you increase the hit points of that object by an amount equal to twice your proficiency bonus, and you increase its AC by 2.
When a spell you cast grants a creature temporary hit points, you increase the temporary hit points by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

Any creature that has its AC increased from a spell you cast or that has a protective ward with hit points granted by a spell you cast also has an additional +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is not cumulative.

feat.name: Celestial Resilience
entries: Your connection with the celestial light that has infused the bright elves is stronger and more pure than that of the common folk, making you hearty like an angel. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to poison and necrotic damage.
You have advantage on saving throws against poison and disease.

feat.name: Crystal Telepathy
entries: You have learned to connect with other minds as easily as you connect ( or once connected) with the Mother Crystai by tapping into your nature as either a being of mind or a being of celestial light. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can communicate telepathically with any creature you can see within 60 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with a creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language. If you have telepathy from another source, the range is doubled, and the target can also respond to you telepathically.

feat.name: Dark of the Deep
entries: You awaken to latent instincts you have from the cold, dark depths of the ocean, unlocking the hidden powers within you and enabling you to conjure inky clouds of mist and darkness. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to cold damage

You learn {@spell fog cloud} and {@spell darkness}, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast those two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for both spells. When you cast one of these spells in this way, you can't be perceived by blindsight while you are in the area.

feat.name: Harbinger of Death
entries: You have been touched by the magic of death itself, whether by ancient lineage or eldritch accident, and the Raven Queen's power flows through you like blood. Instead of growing mad, your mind has become accustomed to the dark beyond death. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your darkvision has a range of 120 feet, instead of 60.
You have resistance to necrotic and psychic damage.
You have advantage on saving throws made to resist curses or to resist having your mind read, and you can't be aged magically.
You learn both the {@spell spare the dying} and {@spell toll the dead|XGE} cantrips, and can cast them at-will. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Kraken Anatomy
entries: Your tentacles are covered in octopus suckers and sturdy enough that fewer are needed to support you, giving you an iron grip and an unparalleled advantage when wrestling. You gain the following benefits:

items: You cannot be disarmed, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape from being {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}, and creatures have disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape from your grapples.
You have two extra arms (tentacles) that you can use as normal or hide inside your body while they aren't holding anything. These arms can't be used to wield shields or weapons.
Your base swimming speed increases by 10 feet.

feat.name: Magic of the Dryads
entries: You learn the ancient magic of the dryads, for which your people have a natural talent. You learn the {@spell thorn whip} spell and can cast it at-will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn {@spell barkskin} and {@spell pass without trace}, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast those two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

feat.name: Nimble Combatant
entries: You are uncannily nimble and agile even for a member of your diminutive race, with matching tenacity and grit. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can take the {@action Dodge} action as a bonus action on your turn. You can only do this up to a number of times equal to 1 + half your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
You have advantage on Dexterity checks made to avoid becoming {@condition grappled} by a creature of a size larger than you.

feat.name: Pixie Magical Talent
entries: You gain a more complete mastery over your natural pixie magic. You learn the {@spell detect evil and good} spell and can cast it at-will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn {@spell detect thoughts} and {@spell fly}, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast those two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

feat.name: Scamp Social Tricks
entries: Your words have a special power, and you've honed that power to an edge. You learn the {@spell friends} and {@spell message} spells and can cast them at-will. You also learn {@spell charm person} and {@spell enthrall}, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast those two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all four spells. When cast in this way, they only require verbal components and can't affect {@condition deafened} creatures.

feat.name: Shard Swarm
entries: You have meditated upon your nature as a fragment of a greater crystal and discovered how to relocate your mind in space, causing your physical body to follow and leaving a fragment of yourself behind to burst apart.

You learn the {@spell misty step} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a short or long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell. When you cast it in this way, the spell's range is doubled, and you can also choose to leave a cloud of crystal dust in a 15-foot diameter sphere centered on the space you teleported from which lasts until the end of your next turn. The cloud is difficult terrain and heavily obscured for other creatures.

feat.name: Sprite Physical Gifts
entries: You have honed your tiny body past its physical peaks, making use of your fey nature to strengthen yourself beyond the normal limits of your size. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your base flying speed increases by 10 feet.
You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift, including for your grapples.
You ignore the effects of your Puny Body racial trait.

feat.name: The Raven's Ear
entries: You have the hearing and mimicry capabilities of the raven, an extension of the corvian talent for memory and observation. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

You can mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds you make can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check opposed by your Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check.

item.name: Amulet of Acid-Proofing
entries: While wearing this amulet, you have resistance to acid damage, equipment that you are holding or carrying can't be harmed by acid, and the base AC of armor that you're wearing can't be reduced by attacks or effects that deal acid damage.

item.name: Brooch of Thorns
entries: This brooch is crafted from vines and bark and covered with thorns that don't pierce the wearer. At the start of each of your turns while wearing it, you can deal {@dice 1d8} piercing damage to each creature that is grappling you. In addition, you deal {@dice 1d4} bonus piercing damage when you hit with an attack using your natural weapons.

item.name: Circlet of Masonry
entries: While you're wearing this austere stone circlet, you have proficiency with mason's tools, and whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the {@skill History} skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

In addition, you can use your action and speak the circlet's command word to gain {@sense tremorsense|MM} that extends out to a range of 60 feet for 10 minutes or until your concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell} If you are a dwarf, the range is doubled and the effect lasts for up to 1 hour instead of 10 minutes. The circlet can't be used in this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Crimson Ash Gloves
entries: These ashen leather gloves are warded against flame.
While wearing them, you aren't damaged by the heat of any objects you're holding, and you are immune to the effects of the {@spell heat metal} spell upon those objects.

In addition, the gloves have 2 charges, and they regain all expended charges daily at dawn. You can use your reaction to expend 1 charge when you take fire damage to put a free hand up and ward against the flames using the gloves. You make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check and reduce the fire damage you take by 10 + the result.

item.name: Dragonguard Shield
entries: While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC, and when you are forced to make a Dexterity or Constitution saving throw for an effect that deals a particular type of damage determined by the shield's creation, you can use your reaction to place the shield in the path of the effect and block it using the shield.

You take no damage from the effect. If it affects an area, the effect treats your space as total cover, potentially changing the area that it affects. Each creature in the area that you're granting cover to has advantage on any saving throws against the effect, and on a success they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save. The shield can't be used in this way again until the next dawn.
The DM chooses the type of damage blocked by the shield or determines it randomly from the options below.

item.name: Elemental Oil
entries: This alchemical oil can coat one weapon or up to 12 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and deals bonus damage on a hit. The amount and type of damage are both determined by the type of oil (see the table below).
Multiple variations of this item exist, as listed below:

item.name: Elemental Oil (Fire)
entries: This alchemical oil can coat one weapon or up to 12 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and deals bonus {@dice 1d6} fire damage on a hit.

entries.name: Fire Oil
entries: This red-orange, slippery oil sparkles with flecks of gold and produces a sulfurous smell when used. A coated item bursts into flame when it is moved quickly, such as when it is used to make an attack, and ignites if it is flammable.

item.name: Elemental Oil (Frost)
entries: This alchemical oil can coat one weapon or up to 12 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and deals bonus {@dice 1d6} cold damage on a hit.

entries.name: Frost Oil
entries: This blue-white oil is viscous and freezing cold. When used, the oil produces a minty smell and freezes into rime upon the coated item for the duration.

item.name: Elemental Oil (Storm)
entries: This alchemical oil can coat one weapon or up to 12 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and deals bonus {@dice 1d6} lightning damage on a hit.

entries.name: Storm Oil
entries: This ocean green-blue oil is filled with flecks of green-yellow material and produces the smell of a thunderstorm when used. A coated item becomes charged with static and, if it is metallic, also slightly magnetic for the duration.

item.name: Elemental Oil (Singing)
entries: This alchemical oil can coat one weapon or up to 12 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and deals bonus {@dice 1d8} thunder damage on a hit.

entries.name: Singing Oil
entries: This silvery-gray oil is flecked with shreds of iron and tin, and it rings melodically as it swirls inside its container. When used, the oil produces a range of harmonic chords at a pleasant volume and soaks into the weapon, which gives off a humming sound for the duration. While the weapon is drawn, the sound can be heard up to 60 feet away.

item.name: Elemental Oil (Arcane)
entries: This alchemical oil can coat one weapon or up to 12 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and deals bonus {@dice 2d6} force damage on a hit.

entries.name: Arcane Oil
entries: This pearlescent pinkish oil is flecked with rainbow sparkles that change color every few seconds. When used, the oil vanishes from the weapon, which hums with silent but tangible arcane power for the duration.

item.name: Elemental Oil (Devouring)
entries: This alchemical oil can coat one weapon or up to 12 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and deals bonus {@dice 3d4} acid damage on a hit.

entries.name: Devouring Oil
entries: This noxious-looking purple oil gives off fumes reminiscent of the smell of stomach acid when used. The strange alchemy used to create the oil ensures that it will only dissolve living materiai so the coated item will remain unharmed (unless it is alive), but constructs and undead are immune to the bonus damage.

item.name: Elemental Oil (Slaying)
entries: This alchemical oil can coat one weapon or up to 12 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and deals bonus {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage on a hit.

entries.name: Slaying Oil
entries: White flecks of bone can be seen suspended in this black slime. When used, the oil produces a putrid smell and seeps into the coated item, which gives off a foul-smelling black smoke for the duration. Constructs and undead are immune to the oil's bonus damage.

item.name: Elemental Poison
entries: These mysteriously-crafted alchemical poisons are designed to even affect elementals and made only by the most capable of alchemists. When an elemental is subjected to one of these poisons, the poison affects the elemental as if it didn't have any immunity or resistance to poison damage or the {@condition poisoned} condition.

Each poison is applied to a weapon - one dose can coat one weapon or piece of ammunition. Applying the poison takes 1 minute. A creature that takes slashing or piercing damage from a weapon or pierce of ammunition coated with the poison is subjected to its effects.
Multiple variations of this item exist, as listed below:

item.name: Elemental Poison (Deep-Earth Solvent)
entries: These mysteriously-crafted alchemical poisons are designed to even affect elementals and made only by the most capable of alchemists. When an elemental is subjected to one of these poisons, the poison affects the elemental as if it didn't have any immunity or resistance to poison damage or the {@condition poisoned} condition.

Each poison is applied to a weapon - one dose can coat one weapon or piece of ammunition. Applying the poison takes 1 minute. A creature that takes slashing or piercing damage from a weapon or pierce of ammunition coated with the poison is subjected to its effects.

entries.name: Deep Earth-Solvent (Injury)
entries: A creature subjected to this greenish poison must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 38 ({@dice 11d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Earth elementals have disadvantage on the saving throw, and when an earth elemental fails the saving throw, it gains vulnerability to all damage for 1 minute. It repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Elemental Poison (Dire Fen Sludge)
entries: These mysteriously-crafted alchemical poisons are designed to even affect elementals and made only by the most capable of alchemists. When an elemental is subjected to one of these poisons, the poison affects the elemental as if it didn't have any immunity or resistance to poison damage or the {@condition poisoned} condition.

Each poison is applied to a weapon - one dose can coat one weapon or piece of ammunition. Applying the poison takes 1 minute. A creature that takes slashing or piercing damage from a weapon or pierce of ammunition coated with the poison is subjected to its effects.

entries.name: Dire Fen Sludge (Injury)
entries: A creature subjected to this dark purple poison must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 35 ({@dice 10d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Water elementals have disadvantage on the saving throw, and when a water elemental fails the saving throw, it is {@condition poisoned} and can't use any abilities that recharge for 1 minute. It repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Elemental Poison (Extinguishing Foam)
entries: These mysteriously-crafted alchemical poisons are designed to even affect elementals and made only by the most capable of alchemists. When an elemental is subjected to one of these poisons, the poison affects the elemental as if it didn't have any immunity or resistance to poison damage or the {@condition poisoned} condition.

Each poison is applied to a weapon - one dose can coat one weapon or piece of ammunition. Applying the poison takes 1 minute. A creature that takes slashing or piercing damage from a weapon or pierce of ammunition coated with the poison is subjected to its effects.

entries.name: Extinguishing Foam (Injury)
entries: A creature subjected to this gray poison must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 35 ({@dice 10d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Fire elementals have disadvantage on the saving throw, and when a fire elemental fails the saving throw, any fire damage it deals for the next 1 minute is halved, and its speed is halved for the same duration. It repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Elemental Poison (Smogbreath Ichor)
entries: These mysteriously-crafted alchemical poisons are designed to even affect elementals and made only by the most capable of alchemists. When an elemental is subjected to one of these poisons, the poison affects the elemental as if it didn't have any immunity or resistance to poison damage or the {@condition poisoned} condition.

Each poison is applied to a weapon - one dose can coat one weapon or piece of ammunition. Applying the poison takes 1 minute. A creature that takes slashing or piercing damage from a weapon or pierce of ammunition coated with the poison is subjected to its effects.

entries.name: Smogbreath Ichor (Injury)
entries: A creature subjected to this blue-black poison must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 ({@dice 9d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Air elementals have disadvantage on the saving throw, and when an air elemental fails the saving throw, it is {@spell poisoned} and can't use any abilities that recharge for 1 minute. It repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Gliding Cloak
entries: This magic cloak can be held in two hands by the wearer and used as a glider. While you are using the cloak in this way, you fall no faster than 100 feet per round, you can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot you descend while falling, and you do not take falling damage.
Your aerial movements using this cloak are highly affected by air currents, and you can be blown off-course if the wind around you is significantly unfavorable.
If you stop holding the cloak with two hands at any time while you're using it, you fall at full speed if you are still aloft, unless you can stop the fall.

item.name: Lightning Rod
entries: While holding this magical rod, when you or a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you takes lightning damage, you can use your reaction to speak the rod's command word and absorb the lightning into the rod.
The triggering creature takes no lightning damage, and gains resistance to lightning damage until the end of its next turn. The rod can't be used in this way again until the next dawn.

Until the end of your next turn, you can use an action to blast one target that you can see within 120 feet with the lightning stored in the rod. You make a ranged spell attack against the target using a +8 bonus. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d8} lightning damage and is pushed 20 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.

item.name: Orb of Primal Fire
entries: This orb of orange-red crystal resembles crystalized fire shaped and smoothed into a roughly spherical shape that fits perfectly in most hands. It carries a single point of yellow-orange light in its center that leaves the orb dimly visible in any darkness, even in magical darkness where any light should be smothered.

Anyone holding the orb can use an action and speak the magical word for fire to activate the orb. If the user succeeds on a DC 21 ability check using a spellcasting ability that it can use to cast spells, it can choose to cast {@spell fire storm}. Otherwise, it casts the new {@spell combustion|TEB} spell and the spell doesn't use concentration, stays centered on the orb, and can't be ended early unless dispelled.
Unless it succeeded on the ability check, the user can't choose any targets to be unaffected by the spell. These spells use a DC 21 for their spell save DC.

Once the orb has been used, it becomes searing hot for {@dice 3d4} days, as if affected by a {@spell heat metal} spell. It can't be cooled or dispelled by any means, and flammable objects that touch the orb instantly ignite. While the orb is heated, it can't be used to cast {@spell fire storm} by any user that isn't wearing crimson ash gloves and doesn't have immunity to fire damage, because concentrating on holding the searing orb is too painful. If the orb is used while it remains heated, it has a 25 percent chance to be unleashed. This chance increases by 25 percent each time the orb fails to be unleashed while heated, lasting until the orb cools down.

If the orb is unleashed, flame blasts out from the orb, filling a 60-foot sphere centered on the orb that spreads around corners. The user that activated the orb dies and is turned to ashes. Each creature in the area must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 12d12} fire damage, or half as much damage on a success. This damage ignores resistance.
The effect damages objects in the area and ignites any flammable objects in the area.

Immediately after being unleashed, the orb rockets into the sky and flies up to {@dice 10d10 + 50} miles away in a random direction, landing like a small meteor, where it remains heated until it cools.

item.name: Ring of Makeshift Immunity
entries: While wearing this ring, if you have resistance to a particular type of damage granted from at least two different sources (such as a spell and a racial trait, or a class feature and a magic item), you also have immunity to that damage type.
The DM chooses the type or determines it randomly from the options below.

item.name: Ring of Poseidon
entries: While wearing this ring, you have advantage on saving throws if you are submerged in water, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

item.name: Ring of Strange Energy
entries: While wearing this ring, your spells and abilities are augmented by a strange energy. When you deal damage of a particular type determined by the type of ring using a spell or class feature, you ignore resistance to that damage type unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to a secondary damage type, and you treat vulnerability to that second damage as vulnerability to both damage types.
The DM chooses the type of ring or determines it randomly from the options below.

item.name: Ring of Cold Flame
entries: While wearing this ring, your spells and abilities are augmented by a strange energy. When you deal fire damage using a spell or class feature, you ignore resistance to fire damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to cold damage, and you treat vulnerability to cold damage as vulnerability to both fire and cold damage.

item.name: Ring of Hungry Fire
entries: While wearing this ring, your spells and abilities are augmented by a strange energy. When you deal fire damage using a spell or class feature, you ignore resistance to fire damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to acid damage, and you treat vulnerability to acid damage as vulnerability to both fire and acid damage.

item.name: Ring of Lunar Frost
entries: While wearing this ring, your spells and abilities are augmented by a strange energy. When you deal cold damage using a spell or class feature, you ignore resistance to cold damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to radiant damage, and you treat vulnerability to radiant damage as vulnerability to both cold and radiant damage.

item.name: Ring of Tempest Rime
entries: While wearing this ring, your spells and abilities are augmented by a strange energy. When you deal cold damage using a spell or class feature, you ignore resistance to cold damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to lightning damage, and you treat vulnerability to lightning damage as vulnerability to both cold and lightning damage.

item.name: Ring of Searing Sparks
entries: While wearing this ring, your spells and abilities are augmented by a strange energy. When you deal lightning damage using a spell or class feature, you ignore resistance to lightning damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to fire damage, and you treat vulnerability to fire damage as vulnerability to both lightning and fire damage.

item.name: Ring of Roaring Storm
entries: While wearing this ring, your spells and abilities are augmented by a strange energy. When you deal lightning damage using a spell or class feature, you ignore resistance to lightning damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to thunder damage, and you treat vulnerability to thunder damage as vulnerability to both lightning and thunder damage.

item.name: Ring of Planar Echoes
entries: While wearing this ring, your spells and abilities are augmented by a strange energy. When you deal thunder damage using a spell or class feature, you ignore resistance to thunder damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to force damage, and you treat vulnerability to force damage as vulnerability to both thunder and force damage.

item.name: Ring of Eldritch Bile
entries: While wearing this ring, your spells and abilities are augmented by a strange energy. When you deal acid damage using a spell or class feature, you ignore resistance to acid damage unless the creature also has resistance or immunity to force damage, and you treat vulnerability to force damage as vulnerability to both acid and force damage.

item.name: Staff of Beasts
entries: You can speak with beasts as if you are under the effects of a {@spell speak with animals} spell while you hold this staff.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell animal friendship} (1 charge), {@spell conjure critters} (new) (1 charge), {@spell conjure animals} (3 charges), {@spell dominate beast} (4 charges), or {@spell sanctuary} (lasts for 10 minutes and only wards against beasts, 1 charge).
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff transforms into loose fur and is destroyed.

item.name: Staff of Corrosion
item.reqAttune: by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: You have resistance to acid damage and your equipment is immune to acid damage while you hold this staff.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell Beluud's corrosive caress|TEB} (new) (1 charge), {@spell Melf's acid arrow} (2 charges), {@spell glistening acid slick|TEB} (new) (4 charges), or {@spell water to acid|TEB} (new) (4 charges).
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff dissolves into slime and is destroyed.

item.name: Staff of Light
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: You have resistance to radiant damage and you can cast the {@spell light} cantrip at-will while you hold this staff.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell flash|TEB} (new) (l charge) {@spell daylight} (3 charges) {@spell holy glare|TEB} (new) (4 charges) or {@spell shining armor|TEB} (new) (5 charges).
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff vanishes in a flash of light and is destroyed.

item.name: Staff of Stone
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: You have resistance to poison damage and you can't be {@condition petrified} while you hold this staff.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell stone blast|TEB} (new) (1 charge), {@spell meld into stone} (3 charges), {@spell stone shape} (4 charges), or {@spell wall of stone} (5 charges).
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff crumbles into dust and is destroyed.

item.name: Staff of the Elements
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: You have resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage while you hold this magical staff.
The staff has 50 charges for the following properties. It regains 4d6 + 2 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a 20. On a 20, the staff regains 1 d 12 + 1 charges.

entries.name: Command Elemental
entries: While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to attempt to command an elemental you can see within 60 feet. This ability costs a number of charges equal to the target's challenge rating (minimum 1 charge). You can choose to control the elemental or banish it.

If you choose control, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition charmed} by you for 1 hour. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the elemental can understand your verbal commands and does its best to obey them.

If you choose banishment, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or suffer the full effects of a {@spell banishment} spell which does not require concentration. The target has disadvantage on this saving throw if your spell save DC is greater than its challenge rating.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability: {@spell chromatic orb} (8th-level version, 6 charges), {@spell conjure elemental} (7 charges), {@spell conjure minor elementals} (6 charges), {@spell elemental bane|XGE}* (4 charges), {@spell elemental weapon} (3 charges), {@spell plane shift}(to elemental planes only, 7 charges), {@spell primordial tides} (new) (8 charges), {@spell primordial ward|XGE}* (5 charges), or {@spell shelter from energy} (new) (7 charges} You can also use the staff to cast the {@spell planar ally} (6 charges) or {@spell planar binding} (5 charges) spells using their normal casting times, but only to affect elementals.

You can also use an action to cast one of the following spells from the staff without using any charges: {@spell chromatic orb}, {@spell control flames|XGE},* {@spell detect magic}, {@spell gust|XGE},* {@spell dragon's breath|XGE},* {@spell mold earth|XGE},* {@spell protection from energy}, or {@spell shape water|XGE}.*

entries.name: Transmute Elements
entries: You can use an action to break the staff over your knee or against a solid surface, which releases elemental magic that alters the form of each creature and object within a number of feet equal to 5 x one-third of the number of charges in the staff, mixing and warping the elements. Ground, water, and air in the area is transformed to slurry: heavily obscured water that is difficult terrain. The staff is destroyed Each other creature and object in the area must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a target takes {@dice 6d12} force damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned} A creature killed by this effect is transformed into slurry.

item.name: Staff of the Glacier
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: While you hold this magical staff, you have resistance to cold damage, fire damage, and poison damage, and you gain a +2 bonus to the damage rolls of spells you cast that deal fire damage.

The staff has 50 charges for the following properties. It regains {@dice 4d6 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a 20. On a 20, the staff regains {@dice 1d12 + 1} charges.

entries.name: Glacial Transformation
entries: You can use an action to raise the staff high whenever you are not indoors or underground and dissolve it into icy winds above you. The winds scatter into the sky, and the staff is destroyed.

Over the next 50 days and 1 hour, snow falls within 1 mile of that location and magically forms into a small glacier covering that area. Then the glacier begins to move normally, and the weather returns to normal (for a glacier} The glacier has a radius of at least 1 mile, and the DM determines its overall size, shape, speed, and temperature. The time it takes the glacier to form is reduced by one day for each charge in the staff. If this 9th-level spell effect is dispelled before the glacier finishes forming, the snow and the glacier vanish.

entries.name: Snow Flurry
entries: While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend up to 5 charges to fill the area within 15 feet of you with frigid snowy winds. Each creature other than you in the area succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC, or else take {@dice 4d8} cold damage plus {@dice 1d8} additional cold damage for each charge expended and have its speed reduced by 15 feet until the end of its next turn. Ground in the area is covered with snow and becomes difficult terrain for the next 10 minutes, or 1 minute in a hot environment.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability: {@spell cold snap|TEB} (new) (3 charges), {@spell cone of cold} (9th-level version, 7 charges), {@spell control weather} (can't change temperature to stages 1-3, 7 charges), {@spell death ward} (4 charges), {@spell encasing ice|TEB} (new) (10 charges), {@spell feign death} (3 charges), {@spell frost armor|TEB} (new) (4 charges), {@spell ice storm} (4 charges), {@spell Otiluke's freezing sphere} (6 charges), {@spell sleet storm} (3 charges), or {@spell wall of ice} (6 charges}.

You can also use an action to cast one of the following spells from the staff without using any charges: {@spell fog cloud}, {@spell frostbite|XGE},* {@spell gust|XGE},* {@spell gust of wind}, {@spell ice sculpture} (new), {@spell ray of frost}, or {@spell shape water|XGE}.*

item.name: Staff of the Volcano
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: While you hold this magical staff, you have resistance to cold damage, fire damage, and poison damage, and you gain a +2 bonus to the damage rolls of spells you cast that deal fire damage.

The staff has 50 charges for the following properties. It regains {@dice 4d6 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a 20. On a 20, the staff regains {@dice 1d12 + 1} charges.

entries.name: Magma Bolt
entries: While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend up to 5 charges to blast one target that you can see within 60 feet. You make a ranged spell attack against the target using your spellcasting ability.

On a hit, the target takes {@dice 6d6} fire damage plus {@dice 2d6} additional fire damage for each charge expended, and it must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the hardening rock. A creature can make a DC 15 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check as an action, freeing itself or a creature within reach from the rock on a success. The rock has AC 17 and hit points equal to 5 + the number of charges expended, and it is immune to fire, poison, and psychic damage.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability: {@spell caldera|TEB} (new) (magma version only, 16 charges), {@spell erupting earth|XGE}* (3 charges), {@spell fireball} (9th-level version, 7 charges), {@spell fire shield} (4 charges), {@spell incendiary cloud} (8 charges), {@spell molten upheaval|TEB} (new) (5 charges), {@spell move earth} (6 charges), {@spell pyrokinesis|TEB} (new) (1 charge), {@spell stinking cloud} (3 charges), {@spell wall of lava} (new) (10 charges), or {@spell wall of fire} (4 charges).

You can also use an action to cast one of the following spells from the staff without using any charges: {@spell burning hands} (3rd-level version), {@spell control flames|XGE},* {@spell fire bolt}, {@spell fog cloud}, {@spell heat metal}, {@spell mold earth|XGE},* or {@spell pyrotechnics|XGE}.*

entries.name: Volcanic Transformation
entries: You can use an action to plant the staff into the ground in your space when you are not indoors and dissolve it into magma. This can be done underground. The magma shoots into the ground and deep into the earth, and the staff is destroyed.

Over the next 50 days and 1 hour, a small volcano grows from the ground in that location with a radius of 1 mile at its base, as if the new {@spell caldera|TEB} spell had been used repeatedly at that location. The time it takes the volcano to appear is reduced by one day for each charge in the staff. If this 9th-level spell effect is dispelled before the volcano finishes appearing, the ground returns to its original state.

item.name: Staff of Wind
item.reqAttune: by a bard, druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: While you hold this staff, you have resistance to thunder damage and you can cast the {@spell feather fall} spell at-will, without expending a spell slot or requiring components.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell swoop|TEB} (new) (1 charge), {@spell thunderwave} (1 charge), {@spell gust of wind} (2 charges), {@spell fly} (3 charges), {@spell wind wall} (3 charges), or {@spell cyclone|TEB} (new) (4 charges).
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff dissolves into mist and is destroyed.

item.name: Traveler's Tassel of Throwing
entries: This gold-threaded tassel was designed by a warrior who always lost their favorite weapons during battle on the road. You can spend 10 minutes to attach this tassel to the handle of one weapon or detach it from a weapon.

While the tassel is attached to a weapon, the weapon is magical. When you throw the weapon as part of an attack on your turn, whether it hits or misses, the weapon flies back into your hand a moment later.

item.name: Weapon Scroll
entries: This magical scroll functions similarly to a spell scroll, except that it is activated by striking the unfurled scroll with a weapon, destroying the scroll. This can be done in place of an attack as part of the {@action Attack} action on the wielder's turn. Doing so casts the scroll's spell upon the weapon without requiring the ability to cast spells. The caster is the wielder who struck the scroll. The spellcasting ability for the spell is the ability score the caster used to make the weapon attack.

Weapon scrolls can only be made for spells that can target a weapon, such as {@spell magic weapon}, {@spell holy weapon|XGE},* or the new {@spell flaring weapon|TEB} spell. A weapon scroll is one rarity level higher than the equivalent spell scroll would be. For example, a 5th-level spell scroll is rare, but a 5th-level weapon scroll of the same spell is very rare.

While wearing this frozen armor, you have resistance to cold damage, you have a +2 bonus to AC, and when you are hit with a melee attack by an attacker within 5 feet, if the attacker doesn't have resistance or immunity to cold damage, its speed is reduced by 15 feet and it has disadvantage on weapon attack rolls until the end of its next turn.
This armor never gets dirty. When the armor is in dim or bright light and no one wearing or carrying the armor is hiding, the armor glints and gleams as if the light was shining directly on it.

While wearing the armor, you can use a bonus action on your turn and speak the armor's command word to cast the new {@spell shining armor|TEB} spell without requiring concentration. The armor can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

You can use a bonus action to speak the command word for this magic weapon, causing icy blue flames to erupt from the striking end. These flames shed dim light in a 30-foot radius. While the sword is ablaze, its wielder has resistance to fire damage, it deals an extra {@dice 1d8} cold damage to any target it hits with a melee attack, and any fire damage those attacks would deal instead becomes cold damage. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the weapon.
This weapon is not flammable regardless of the materials used in its construction. Cold damage dealt by the weapon is maximized against fire elementals.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, the weapon has 3 charges, and it regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you make an attack with this weapon, you can replace the attack by speaking the weapon's command word and expending 1 charge to cast thunderwave or to cast earth tremor (from Xanathar's Guide to Eve.tything1 using your Strength score as the spellcasting ability score.

You gain a + 1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Attacks made with the weapon also deal {@dice 1d6} bonus thunder damage that is maximized against constructs, objects, and earth elementals.

When you hit a target with an attack using this weapon, you can speak the hammer's command word. The attack deals {@dice 3d10} bonus thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn. This thunder damage is maximized against constructs, objects, and earth elementals. Once you have done so, the hammer can't be used in this way again until the next dawn.
When you hit with an attack using this magic weapon, the target takes an extra {@dice 1d8} lightning damage. Also, while you hold the weapon, you have resistance to lightning damage.

In addition, you can use an action and speak the weapon's command word, pointing the weapon at a location and surging as a bolt of lightning to that point. You cast the new {@spell Beluud's brutal jaunt|TEB} spell targeting a location within range. The spell deals lightning damage instead of force damage, it is cast at 5th-level and the spell's range is doubled. Once this ability has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, the weapon has 3 charges, and it regains all expended charges daily at dawn. You can speak the weapon's command word and expend 1 charge to cast {@spell cyclone strike|TEB} (new), using this weapon to make the spell's attacks. You have advantage on those attacks. You can also spend 1 charge to cast {@spell gale weapons|TEB} (new) targeting only this weapon, without requiring concentration.

reward.name: Boon of Animal Veneration
entries: You can cast {@spell animal friendship} and the new {@spell conjure critters|TEB} spell at-will, without using a spell slot, but you can only target or conjure a particular kind of animal determined by the boon, such as snakes, cats, birds of prey, or even dinosaurs.

reward.name: Boon of Fiery Speed
entries: You can cast the new {@spell trailblazer|TEB} spell without using a spell slot or any components. When you do, each creature of your choice that can see and hear you can use its reaction to prepare to run. At the start of its next turn, it dashes without using any actions to do so.
Once you do this, you can't use this boon again until you finish a long rest.

reward.name: Boon of Eldritch Haste
entries: You can use a bonus action to cast the new {@spell storm god's haste|TEB} spell targeting yourself without using a spell slot or any components. Once you do this, you can't use this boon again until you finish a long rest.

reward.name: Boon of Gaia's Touch
entries: You can cast {@spell awaken} or the new {@spell force of nature|TEB} spell without using a spell slot or material components, but you can only target plants when you do so. Once you do, you can't use this boon again until you finish a long rest.

reward.name: Boon of Magic Physique
entries: You can cast the new {@spell enhance body|TEB} spell on yourself without using a spell slot or components. Once you do, you can't use this boon again until you finish a long rest.

reward.name: Boon of the Golem Pilot
entries: You can cast the new {@spell golem armor|TEB} spell without using a spell slot or any components. You gain this boon as either {@i ice}, {@i lava}, {@i metal}, or {@i stone}, and you always summon that kind of golem armor. Once you do this, you can't use this boon again until you finish a long rest.

reward.name: Boon of Slicing Power
entries: You can cast the new {@spell force strike|TEB} spell at-will and you can cast the {@spell annihilation disk|TEB} spell without using a spell slot if you're wielding a melee weapon you're proficient with that deals slashing damage. Neither spell requires components. Once you cast {@spell annihilation disk|TEB} in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

condition.name: Ablaze
entries: Lorsqu'une créature est en feu, que ce soit un feu magique ou non, elle est embrasée. L'embrasement est une nouvelle condition qui unifie les effets similaires causés par certains sorts, monstres et effets, non seulement dans ce compendium, mais aussi dans le matériel officiellement publié. Si un sort ou un effet décrit le fait de mettre le feu à une créature, de l'embraser, de l'enflammer ou de la faire brûler, cette créature est embrasée.

Une créature embrasée subit {@dice 1d10} de dégâts de feu au début de chacun de ses tours, sauf si l'effet à l'origine des flammes spécifie un montant de dégâts à la place. Certains effets, comme les sorts {@spell immolation|XGE} ou {@spell searing smite}, causent un montant de dégâts différent.

Éteindre le feu qui embrase une créature varie en difficulté en fonction de la cause de l'incendie. Les flammes non magiques peuvent être éteintes facilement : une créature peut effectuer une action pour éteindre le feu si celui-ci est à sa portée ou si elle dispose d'un autre moyen d'éteindre une flamme plus éloignée, comme le sort {@spell control flames|XGE}. Si la flamme est immergée dans l'eau ou dans un fluide étouffant similaire, elle est étouffée automatiquement.

Les flammes magiques peuvent être plus difficiles à éteindre, en fonction de leur source. Par exemple, le sort {@spell searing smite} peut être éteint aussi facilement que n'importe quel feu non magique, mais les flammes du sort {@spell immolation|XGE} ne peuvent être éteintes qu'en mettant fin au sort, soit par un jet de sauvegarde réussi, soit par un effet comme {@spell dispel magic}.

condition.name: Buried
entries: Lorsqu'une créature est entourée de tous côtés par une substance solide qu'elle ne peut pas traverser, elle est enterrée. L'enfouissement est une nouvelle condition causée par certains sorts, objets, monstres et effets de ce recueil. À la discrétion du MJ, elle peut également être causée par certains événements naturels, comme être submergé dans un glissement de terrain, un effondrement ou une avalanche, ou simplement être enterré vivant.

Pour être enterrée, une cible doit être piégée dans une substance trop solide pour qu'elle puisse nager ou voler à travers. Sans une substance appropriée dans laquelle être enterrée, une cible ne peut pas souffrir de cette condition. Si une créature ou un objet n'est que partiellement enterré, il ne souffre pas de cette condition.

La substance dans laquelle il est enterré offre une couverture totale de toutes les directions. À moins que l'observateur ne puisse voir à travers cette substance, elle bloque également la ligne de vue. De plus, une créature enterrée souffre des maux suivants tant qu'elle reste enterrée :

items: Il ne peut pas utiliser {@sense blindsight}, et il est {@condition deafened} sauf s'il a {@sense tremorsense|MM}.
Il est {@condition paralyzed}, sauf qu'il n'est pas {@condition incapacitated}.

Il ne peut pas respirer ou fournir des composantes somatiques pour les sorts. S'il a normalement besoin de respirer, il ne peut pas parler ou fournir des composantes verbales, il a un désavantage sur les jets de sauvegarde effectués pour maintenir sa concentration, et il doit retenir sa respiration ou suffoquer.

entries: Une créature ne peut pas être enterrée dans une substance qu'elle peut traverser à la nage ou en creusant. Si une créature enterrée acquiert cette capacité après avoir été enterrée, elle cesse immédiatement de souffrir de cette condition. Une créature est également immunisée contre cette condition si elle est immunisée contre l'une des conditions {@condition grappled}, {@condition restrained} ou {@condition paralyzed}.

spellcasting.name: Alternate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The tortle is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The tortle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shell Defense
entries: The tortle withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, the tortle is {@condition prone}, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge.

spellcasting.name: Alternate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hobgoblin is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Arcane Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a damaging spell attack if that target is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin and that ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Army Arcana
entries: When the hobgoblin casts a spell that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to succeed on the required saving throw.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The grung is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following ranger spells:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The grung can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Poisonous Skin
entries: Any creature that grapples the grung or otherwise comes into direct contact with the grung's skin must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature no longer in direct contact with the grung can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The grung's long jump is up to 25 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

variant.name: Grung Poison
entries: Grung poison loses its potency 1 minute after being removed from a grung. A similar breakdown occurs if the grung dies. A creature {@condition poisoned} by a grung can suffer an additional effect that varies depending on the grung's skin color. This effect lasts until the creature is no longer {@condition poisoned} by the grung.

entries.name: Green
entries: The {@condition poisoned} creature can't move except to climb or make standing jumps. If the creature is flying, it can't take any actions or reactions unless it lands.

entries.name: Blue
entries: The {@condition poisoned} creature must shout loudly or otherwise make a loud noise at the start and end of its turn.

entries.name: Purple
entries: The {@condition poisoned} creature feels a desperate need to soak itself in liquid or mud. It can't take actions or move except to do so or to reach a body of liquid or mud.

entries.name: Red
